The SDF continue to deploy reinforcements to the front in the Aleppo Governorate after clashes in Kurdish majority neighbourhoods in Aleppo city ended with a ceasefire and the evacuation of Asayish security personnel. 
This convoy is reportedly enroute to the Tishreen dam area. 
@wfwitness

Overnight, Odesa City once again came under attack from Russian Geran-2 drones.
Around a dozen impacts were recorded in the area of the City Centre / Moldavanka District. 
The target doesn't appear to have been energy infrastructure.

Overnight, Odesa City once again came under attack from Russian Geran-2 drones.
Around a dozen impacts were recorded in the area of the City Centre / Moldavanka District. 
The target doesn't appear to have been energy infrastructure.

Footage of the Russian Iskander-M ballistic missile strikes on the Kharkiv TEC-5 Combined Heat and Power Plant.   3 Impacts were recorded, along with several Geran-2 drone strikes.  Credit to Intel Cams | OSINT for the first clip.

In addition to the strikes in and around Kharkiv City, Geran-2 drones also attacked targets in other parts of Kharkiv Oblast.
The following was hit:
- "Bohodukhiv" 110 kV electrical substation in the city of Bohodukhiv by several drones. Widespread power outages were reported [Media 2].
- Unknown target in the city of Izyum by at least 2 drones [Media 1].
- Unknown target in the city of Zlatopil.
- Unknown target in the area of the city of Merefa.
- Unknown target in the town of Pechenihy by multiple drones.
- Unknown target in the city of Lyubotyn. 
- Unknown target in the town of Velykyi Burluk by at least 3 drones.

In addition to the strikes in and around Kharkiv City, Geran-2 drones also attacked targets in other parts of Kharkiv Oblast.
The following was hit:
- "Bohodukhiv" 110 kV electrical substation in the city of Bohodukhiv by several drones. Widespread power outages were reported [Media 2].
- Unknown target in the city of Izyum by at least 2 drones [Media 1].
- Unknown target in the city of Zlatopil.
- Unknown target in the area of the city of Merefa.
- Unknown target in the town of Pechenihy by multiple drones.
- Unknown target in the city of Lyubotyn. 
- Unknown target in the town of Velykyi Burluk by at least 3 drones.

Footage of the Russian Iskander-M ballistic missile strikes on the Kharkiv TEC-5 Combined Heat and Power Plant.   3 Impacts were recorded, along with several Geran-2 drone strikes.  Credit to Intel Cams | OSINT for the first clip.

Some of the Iskander-M and Geran-2 drone strikes near Kharkiv City targeted the Nova Poshta terminal in the town of Korotych.
At least 2 civilians were killed and 1 injured.
NASA FIRMS data shows large fires burning at the Kryvyi Rih Thermal Power Plant in Zelenodolsk, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast, as a result of the earlier Iskander-M strikes.  Coordinates: 47.5436, 33.66164

In addition to the strikes on the Kryvyi Rih TPP, eastern Dnipropetrovsk Oblast also came under attack.
- 2 Iskander-M ballistic missiles launched from Millerovo Airbase, Rostov Oblast, impacted an unknown target in the town of Petropavlivka [Media 2].
- At least 4 Geran-2 drones impacted the town of Vasylkivka [Media 1].
- 1-2 Geran-2 drones impacted the city of Shakhtarske.

In addition to the strikes on the Kryvyi Rih TPP, eastern Dnipropetrovsk Oblast also came under attack.
- 2 Iskander-M ballistic missiles launched from Millerovo Airbase, Rostov Oblast, impacted an unknown target in the town of Petropavlivka [Media 2].
- At least 4 Geran-2 drones impacted the town of Vasylkivka [Media 1].
- 1-2 Geran-2 drones impacted the city of Shakhtarske.
There is an increased threat of Iskander-K cruise missile launches for the next 4 hours.
No Iskander-K cruise missiles are expected to be used today.
No Iskander-K cruise missiles are expected to be used today.
Nevermind. Iskander-Ks are detected in Ukrainian airspace.
Nevermind. Iskander-Ks are detected in Ukrainian airspace.
2 groups are detected so far. Both flying to Kyiv.

1 group to Ukrainka/Trypillya TPP, Kyiv Oblast.
1 group to Drabiv, Cherkasy Oblast.

Correction: 3 groups are detected:
1 group to Kaniv, Cherkasy Oblast.
1 group to Boryspil, Kyiv Oblast.
1 group to Pyriatyn, Poltava Oblast.

1 group is maneuvering near northeastern Kyiv
1 group is approaching Korsun'-Shevchenkivs'kyi, Cherkasy Oblast.
1 group is still flying west through northern Poltava Oblast.

1 group is still flying near Korsun'-Shevchenkivs'kyi, Cherkasy Oblast.
1 new group is flying to Pereiaslav, Kyiv Oblast from the northeast.
1 group is flying to Drabiv, Cherkasy Oblast from the east.
1 group is bypassing Kyiv from the north.

1 group is flying to Borodyanka, northern Kyiv Oblast on a southwestern course.
1 group is bypassing Pereiaslav, Kyiv Oblast from the south on a western course. Another group is following behind.
1 group is flying to Bila Tserkva, Kyiv Oblast from the southeast.
1 group is approaching the 750 kV Kyiv substation in Nalyvaikivka

1 group is approaching Nalyvaikivka, Kyiv Oblast.
1 group is flying north to Makariv, Kyiv Oblast.
1 group is flying northwest from Kaniv, Cherkasy Oblast.
1 group is approaching Kaniv from the northeast.
Multiple impacts to the 750 kV substation in Nalyvaikivka
Military Situation In Ukraine On January 12, 2026 (Maps Update)
Military Situation In Ukraine On January 12, 2026 (Maps Update)

Ukraine Is Losing Ground To Russian Army In Zaporozhye Faster Than Ever (Videos)
On January 12, the Russian military captured another settlement in Zaporozhye from Kiev forces, with reports suggesting that sever other settlements are about to be cleared.
The capture of Novoboykovskoye, located to the east of Stepnohirsk, by the Vostok [East] Group of Forces was confirmed by the Russian Ministry of Defense. Russian troops stormed the settlement just a few days earlier. Kiev forces failed to put on any real resistance.
A similar situation is reportedly developing in Prymorske, to the northwest of Stepnohirsk, where Kiev forces have very much lost control of the large settlement.
According to preliminary reports, the last Ukrainian positions in the northern part of the Prymorske had been already captured, and work to fully secure the settlement is nearing completion. The Russian MoD could confirm the capture of the settlement within a few days.
Read more 
HERE

Ukraine Is Losing Ground To Russian Army In Zaporozhye Faster Than Ever (Videos)
On January 12, the Russian military captured another settlement in Zaporozhye from Kiev forces, with reports suggesting that sever other settlements are about to be cleared.
The capture of Novoboykovskoye, located to the east of Stepnohirsk, by the Vostok [East] Group of Forces was confirmed by the Russian Ministry of Defense. Russian troops stormed the settlement just a few days earlier. Kiev forces failed to put on any real resistance.
A similar situation is reportedly developing in Prymorske, to the northwest of Stepnohirsk, where Kiev forces have very much lost control of the large settlement.
According to preliminary reports, the last Ukrainian positions in the northern part of the Prymorske had been already captured, and work to fully secure the settlement is nearing completion. The Russian MoD could confirm the capture of the settlement within a few days.

A WEEKEND OF STRATEGIC SHIFTS: RUSSIA GAINS GROUND AMID HIGH-INTENSITY FIGHTING

Russian-Ukrainian Strike Exchange: Black Sea Vessel Attacks, UK Unveils New Rocket Project For Ukraine
On the night of January 12, Russian air defense forces destroyed or suppressed 13 Ukrainian drones. The highest number was intercepted over the Rostov region. Simultaneously, the Ukrainian side reported intercepting or suppressing 135 out of 156 Russian attack UAVs. 
The day before, attention was drawn to published information about the start of design work in the UK on an operational-tactical ballistic missile for the Armed Forces of Ukraine, codenamed Nightfall. The $12.1 million R&D contract is distributed among three industrial groups, one of which is presumably MBDA Missile Systems. According to data that emerged as early as August 2025, the project's goal is to create a highly mobile missile system with a range exceeding 500 km (some reports say up to 600 km) and with low infrared and radar signatures.
üëâ

HERE

Control of Communications in Zaporizhzhia: Fight for Orikhiv‚Äôs Highways Escalates in Ukraine 
‚ñ™Ô∏è
In the Zaporizhzhia sector, the Russian army's control of Bilohiria and the interaction of the "Dnepr" and "West" groupings are creating prerequisites for an operational encirclement of the Orikhiv district. The key objective is to intercept the H-08 and T-04-08 highways. 
‚ñ™Ô∏è
In the Pokrovsk sector, following the conclusion of combat operations in Pokrovsk and Myrnohrad, Russian forces have advanced towards Bilytske and Shevchenko, while intense fighting continues in Hryshyne. 
‚ñ™Ô∏è
In the Kostiantynivka sector, fighting continues for Novodmytrivka and Predtechyne. Meanwhile, Russian assault detachments have advanced into the southeastern part of Kostiantynivka and captured strongpoints west of Stepanivka. 
‚ñ™Ô∏è
In the Sumy sector, Russian "North" assault units have significantly expanded their offensive front, advancing 14 sections in the Sumy district for a total of up to 850 meters. 
Read more 
HERE
